intro: Duvalia reclinata var. angulata, commonly known as the angular duvalia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, angular leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pale purple or white, often attracting pollinators such as bees and birds. Due to its unique foliage and ornamental value, it is a popular plant among horticultural enthusiasts.
